Day 1.title: Scaling with Rust: Building Secure and Reliable Digital Infrastructure for the Future
Day 1.theme: Exploring Rust as a catalyst for secure, reliable, and future-ready digital infrastructure. Empowering industries and nations to scale innovation with confidence.

sessions.context: Participants arrive, settle in, and connect with early attendees.

Opening remarks by UDM University Management, the Mayor, and the Minister of Post and Telecommunication. Marks the official launch of the Rust Africa Campus Tour in Cameroon. Includes a keynote by Yannick Siewe (Adorsys).

sessions.session: Keynote: “Rust’s Ascendancy – Powering the Next Generation of Software”
sessions.context: Presentation on Rust’s growing importance in secure and scalable software systems.

sessions.session: Panel Discussion: “Scaling with Rust – Industry Leaders Share Their Strategies”
sessions.context: Panel featuring John Zeller, Francis Pouatcha, Evans Yemey, and representatives from the Rust Foundation discussing real-world Rust adoption in enterprise systems.
Invitation-only session for startup executives, organizational leaders, and guests. Held at Lewatt Hotel.

sessions.session: Talk: “Fortifying Cybersecurity and Cyber-Defense for Africa’s Digital Future”
sessions.context: Discussion on Rust’s role in eliminating software vulnerabilities and strengthening cybersecurity across Africa.

sessions.session: Grand Panel: “The Future of Rust in Africa – Opportunities, Challenges & the Path Forward”
sessions.context: Panel with Francis Pouatcha, Enow Scott, Mordecai Emmanuel, Evans Yemey, and Tekum Emmanuella exploring the Rust ecosystem in Africa.
Wrap-up of Day 1’s learnings followed by a group photo.
Guided city tour with event officials and special guests.

Day 2.title: Building the Future: Advanced Rust & Real-World Applications (Workshop Day)
Day 2.theme: Deep dive into advanced Rust concepts and real-world applications driving innovation and career growth.

sessions.context: Arrive, settle in, and prepare for a full day of Rust learning.
Overview of Rust’s history and evolution.
Hands-on installation session with live guidance.
Practical Rust talk by Francesco Ciulla.
Practical Rust demo by Ingrid Kamga.

sessions.session: Panel: “What’s It Like to Use Rust?”
sessions.context: Discussion on Rust’s developer experience: compiler, Cargo, and productivity.
Intro to learning resources: The Book, Rustlings, and community networks.
Summary and next steps by Rust Africa leadership.
One-on-one mentoring and project idea discussions.
